header: The Vision of the Flying Scroll

verse: I ·looked up again [turned and lifted my eyes] and saw a flying scroll.
·The angel [He] asked me, “What do you see?”

And he said to me, “This is the curse that ·will go [or is going out] all over the land. One side says every thief will be ·taken away [banished; purged]. The other side says everyone who ·makes false promises [swears falsely] will be ·taken away [banished; purged].

The Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says, ‘I will send it to the houses of thieves and to those who ·use my name to make false promises [swear falsely]. The scroll will stay in that person’s house and destroy it with its wood and stones.’”
Then the ·angel [messenger] who was talking with me came forward and said to me, “·Look up [Lift up your eyes] and see what is ·going out [or coming; appearing].”
Then the lid made of lead was raised, and there was a woman sitting inside the basket.
The angel said, “The woman ·stands for [is] wickedness.” Then he pushed her back into the basket and put the lid back down.
Then I ·looked up [lifted my eyes] and saw two women going out with the wind in their wings. Their wings were like those of a stork, and they lifted up the basket between earth and the ·sky [heaven].
I asked the ·angel [messenger] who was talking with me, “Where are they taking the basket?”
“They are going to Babylonia to build a ·temple [house] for it,” he answered. “When ·the temple [it] is ready, they will set the basket there ·in its place [or on its base/pedestal].”
